meanings.sent1: The reticulums of the spider's web glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The fence was made of reticulums of metal wires.
meanings.sent3: The reticulums of yarn in the knitting project got tangled up.
meanings.sent4: The city's streets formed a reticulum of pathways leading in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The reticulums of veins in the leaf created a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: A small network or mesh structure
meanings.sent1: The reticulums of cracks on the wall needed repair.
meanings.sent2: The reticulums of roots spread out from the tiny plant.
meanings.sent3: The reticulums of wires in the electronics were hard to untangle.
meanings.sent4: The reticulum of tiny streets in the village was charming to explore.
meanings.sent5: The reticulums of branches intertwined to form a cozy nest for the bird.

meanings.definition: A network of intercellular fibers in certain cells
meanings.sent1: The reticulums of fibers within the muscle cells helped with movement.
meanings.sent2: The reticulums of connections between neurons allowed for communication.
meanings.sent3: The reticulums of threads in the fabric of the shirt gave it strength.
meanings.sent4: The reticulum of relationships within the community supported each other.
meanings.sent5: The reticulums of pathways in the brain facilitated information processing.
